sentences.english: The Aztecs, Maya, And Their Predecessors, 4Th Edition.
sentences.chinese: 阿茲特克人，瑪雅人和他們的前輩，第4版。

sentences.english: The Mayans lived in Central America thousands of years ago.
sentences.chinese: 數千年前，瑪雅人生活在中美洲。

sentences.english: 'The Mayans saw this coming thousands of years ago,' says one character.
sentences.chinese: 一位角色說，瑪雅人在幾千年前就看到了這點。

sentences.english: The Mayas do not just disappeared, they were evacuated by spaceships and flew away.
sentences.chinese: 瑪雅人並非突然消失了，而是搭乘宇宙飛船撤走了。

sentences.english: Around A. D. 600, the Mayas were the main aboriginal group in Central America.
sentences.chinese: 公元600年左右，瑪雅人是中美洲主要的土著居民。

sentences.english: The Mayas believed that chocolate had mystical properties but cocoa also had commercial value.
sentences.chinese: 瑪雅人相信巧克力具有神祕的特性，也具有商業價值。

sentences.english: Red was the color the ancient Mayas associated with death and resurrection.
sentences.chinese: 紅色是古代瑪雅人死亡與復活聯繫在一起的顏色。

sentences.english: A codex is a Mayan written record.
sentences.chinese: 瑪雅古籍是瑪雅人的文字記錄。

sentences.english: The Maya are thought by many to have used slash-and-burn agriculture.
sentences.chinese: 很多人認爲瑪雅人採取的是刀耕火種的農業種植方式。

sentences.english: The cultures visited by the Galactic Maya were shamanic.
sentences.chinese: 這個被銀河的瑪雅人探訪的文明是薩滿教的。

sentences.english: Or take the example of the Mayans in Central America.
sentences.chinese: 再來舉一箇中美洲瑪雅人的例子。

sentences.english: No, man, I'm just saying that maybe those Mayans were on to something.
sentences.chinese: 不，小子，我只是說也許那些瑪雅人是那麼一回事。

sentences.english: As powerful Mayas can not control the prediction, we either.
sentences.chinese: 正如強大的瑪雅人都不能控制預言，我們也不能。

sentences.english: But it is the Mayan calendar that is causing people to worry.
sentences.chinese: 但是就是這些瑪雅人的歷法使人擔憂。

sentences.english: What did the Maya themselves think about End Times?
sentences.chinese: 對於世界末日，瑪雅人自己是怎麼看的呢？

sentences.english: His subject now is 2012. The prophecies of Mayan. How does that sound to you?
sentences.chinese: 他在研究2012。瑪雅人的預言。你覺得怎麼樣？

definition: slave-owning society (precedes feudal society 封建社會|封建社会 in Marxist theory)
the philosophy of materialism, doctrine that physical matter is the whole of reality
altar lamp burning day and night
moon landing/to land on the moon
Europa (moon of Jupiter), aka Jupiter II
the Bronze Age/also written 青銅時代|青铜时代[Qing1 tong2 Shi2 dai4]
eyewitness (to an incident)/witness (to a legal transaction)
